item.title: WWII veteran marries at 100: the first dance.
item.description:
Can you imagine getting married at 100 years old? That’s exactly what WWII Veteran Harold Terens did. We remember when both he and his wife both got to enjoy their first dance at our Annual Veterans Conference.
For the past 28 years the AVC has brought together dozens of notable veterans of the last 80 years of history for our Annual Veterans Conference, where they share their lessons and experiences with an audience of several hundred students from each of the military service academies & ROTC programs from across the country. Participants range from surviving heroes of WWII to recipients of the Medal of Honor to young Special Operations veterans of today’s military. The weekend of programming concludes with American Valor: A Salute to Our Heroes, a black-tie gala filmed as a Veterans Day television special, airing on ABC, CBS, NBC and Fox stations across the country, and to all military personnel around the world on American Forces Network. We look forward to our 28th Annual Conference & Gala this coming November!

item.title: One Man, an Army: Medal of Honor's Daring Charge
item.description: What does it take to charge an entire enemy position alone? This video tells the powerful, true story of a soldier's unflinching bravery and the heroic actions that earned him the Medal of Honor.

item.title: I Told The Medic "Don't Waste Your Time On Me!"
item.description: What happens when a wounded soldier faces impossible odds? This powerful memoir shares a veteran's story, recounting the difficult decision he made to tell the medic to prioritize others during intense combat.

item.title: Ball turret gunner forced to bail out of his B-17.
item.description: WWII Veteran Lester Schrenk joined the U.S. Army Air Forces on his 19th birthday in November 1942. He was assigned to the only open position left - a ball turret gunner on a B-17 bomber. He shares an experience where he was forced to bail out of his B-17 bomber.

item.title: Losing One of my Marines in Fallujah
item.description: This powerful memoir documents the immense personal cost of the Battle of Fallujah. A veteran shares his heartfelt story of losing one of his Marines and the profound impact of that loss.

item.title: Marine Combat in the the Pacific’s Battle of Peleliu!
item.description: Go inside one of the toughest battles of WWII. This video documents the unflinching courage and the sheer intensity of combat faced by Marines during the Battle of Peleliu.

item.title: The Legacy of Bull Randleman: More Than Just a Role!
item.description: The iconic role was based on a true hero. This video shares the unfiltered story of Bull Randleman, explaining the immense impact of his service and why his name is legendary in military history.

item.title: What It Means to Be a Ranger in Vietnam!
item.description: Go inside the experience of an elite soldier. This video documents the challenging missions and psychological realities faced by Army Rangers deployed during the Vietnam War.

item.title: Where Army Rangers Got Their Famous Motto
item.description: What is the secret history behind the Army Rangers' famous motto? This video explores the true story of its creation, detailing the courage and spirit that inspired the legendary phrase.

item.title: A Holocaust survivor's daring story of survival.
item.description: Holocaust survivor Ben Lesser was born in Kraków, Poland in 1928. After the German army invaded Poland in 1939, Ben and his family were subject to countless acts of violence by Nazi soldiers and forced to live in the Bochnia Ghetto. He shared a story with us on how he hid diamonds in his shoes from Nazi soldiers.

item.title: Capturing the Famous "Blue Marble" Photo of Earth
item.description: What does it take to capture a photo of our entire planet? This video goes behind the scenes of the famous "Blue Marble" photo, detailing the historic mission and the impact of the incredible image.

item.title: Last Living D-Day Pathfinder Pilot on the Mission That Changed the War
item.description: Go inside the cockpit for the mission that changed the war. The last surviving D-Day Pathfinder pilot shares his powerful, first-hand account of the crucial drop that set the stage for the Normandy invasion.

item.title: 'Forrest Gump' Star Gary Sinise on Real Life Military Inspiration
item.description: The role of Lt. Dan changed his life. Gary Sinise discusses the profound impact that meeting and working with real soldiers had on his career and his later life's work as a veteran advocate

item.title: Why Navy Seal Doesn't Wear Trident
item.description: Ever wonder why you see Navy SEALs without their Trident insignia? This video breaks down the specific reasons, covering official protocol, operational security, and the personal choice of the veteran.

item.title: A veteran's story of enduring captivity.
item.description: This powerful memoir shares a veteran’s somber and unfiltered account of the profound hardship and psychological abuse he endured while a prisoner of war in Vietnam.

item.title: The costly river crossing that started the fight.
item.description: Ernest “Ernie” Mogor along with the 76th Infantry Division would enter combat crossing the Sauer and Moselle Rivers in the vicinity of Echternach, Luxembourg. The river crossing was met with heavy German resistance and gave Mogor his first taste of combat.

item.title: How We Dealt With a Japanese Sniper on Tarawa
item.description: Go inside the brutal reality of the Battle of Tarawa. This video documents a soldier’s courage and critical tactics used to deal with a persistent and lethal enemy sniper.

item.title: Breaking Down the AC-130 Gunship
item.description: This technical guide goes inside the AC-130. We'll show you how the massive armaments and advanced technology come together to make it one of the most feared aircraft in combat.

item.title: Medal of Honor recipient and Vietnam Veteran Harvey Barnum Jr. explains what “Skipper” means in the Marine Corps.
item.description: What is the meaning of "Skipper" in the Marine Corps? Medal of Honor recipient Harvey Barnum Jr. explains the traditional term and its deep significance within the corps.

item.title: The path to becoming a Navy SEAL: Edward Byers' story.
item.description:
Edward C. Byers Jr. aspired to become an elite soldier in the United States military. After a deployment with the 26th Marine Expeditionary Unit in 1999, Byers was accepted to attend Basic Underwater Demolition/SEAL training. He graduated with BUD/S Class 242 and fulfilled his dream of becoming a Navy SEAL.
He shares the mental and physical hurdles he had to overcome while training to become a Navy Seal.
